data.message: Agree entirely with Jamie. Don't want Facebook messenger app. I should be able to see messages without downloading that app.  Thank u.

replies.message: Hi Dominic. We hear your concern. Separating messages from the Facebook app into Messenger allows us to provide a better overall experience to the Facebook community, and linking between the two apps is quick and easy. -Elissa
Still don't need it or want it

Wait, you will /remove/ messages from the default app? If that's the case looks like I will be using my browser set to desktop mode. I tried the app and didn't see a place where I could make myself invisible.

I use FB messages/chat to talk with people I want to, and I do not appear visible to the general public because I don't need to be chatting with everyone on my friends list. Don't need to, don't want to, and since the app demanded I appear online to everyone I deleted it after just 5 minutes.

In fact that debacle hurt some feelings. Someone saw me online after such a long time (since I have chat turned off for everyone basically) and figured I had long ago blocked them (specifically and personally, instead of the reality of "everyone but my partner") but had just re-added them. Once I deleted the app they thought I had re-blocked them only minutes after having come online again. Then I got yelled at/guilt tripped via message through another person (the chat person contacted a relative about all this, trying to make me look bad). Just the kind of BS someone with depression needs in their life you know?

Not appearing online has been a staple of chat programs since AoL Instant Message over a decade ago. It is like trying to make a pizza without cheese. It isn't even pizza, and it makes everyone wonder what the heck you were thinking...
Don't want the messenger app! Have heard NO good reviews?
I use it only because I don't have a smart phone but I don't like having to constantly toggle between the main FB window and Messenger to see messages while I'm on FB. Very inconvenient.
